intro: Lavrania picta subsp. parvipunctata, commonly known as the small-punctured lavrania, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually covered in fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
